1.title: NBC News' Madelyn Fernstrom Cautions About Drug and Food Interactions
1.plot: NBC News Health and Diet Editor Dr. Madelyn Fernstrom wants people to be aware of foods that don't interact well with certain medications. Her new book, "Don't Eat This If You're Taking That" defines the foods you should be cautious with.

2.title: Former NYC Ballet Soloist on Managing Life with Type 1 Diabetes
2.plot: Zippora Karz was a soloist with the New York City Ballet when she noticed sores underneath her arms. Find out how this skin condition turned into Type 2 diabetes misdiagnosis and her eventual Type 1 diabetes diagnosis.

3.title: 3 Celebrities Who Are Thriving with Multiple Sclerosis
3.plot: Did you know Montel Williams, Ann Romney and Courtney Galiano are all living healthy lives with Mulitple Sclerosis? Find out what is working for them to keep their lives active and happy.

4.title: How Tia Mowry Is Helping Her Family Fight the Flu This Season
4.plot: Actress and author Tia Mowry is a hands-on mom who is offering families great tips for fighting the flu this season. Learn how she is keeping her family healthy and happy.

5.title: How Alyssa Milano Changed Her Eating Habits
5.plot: Alyssa Milano is the mother of two kids, an actress and a businesswoman. It was hard for her to balance healthy eating with such a full life. She shares her helpful food tips along with registered dietician, Chef Diane Henderiks.

6.title: Why Carol Burnett Is the Pioneer of #GirlBoss
6.plot: Carol Burnett changed the face of comedy when she helmed her own variety show back in 1967. CBS executives said it was a "man's game," but she proved them wrong. Learn more about Carol Burnett's game-changing career.

7.title: John Legend and Chrissy Teigen: Prepping for Parenthood
7.plot: All eyes were on John Legend and Chrissy Teigen at the 2016 NAACP Image Awards recently. Not only was the Grammy winner honored for his charitable work, Legend was gushing about his wife and their pregnancy.

8.title: Dorothy Hamill Celebrates 8 Years of Being Cancer-Free
8.plot: Dorothy Hamill is hitting several big milestones this year - she's turning 60, it's the 40th anniversary of her gold-medal performance at the 1976 Winter Olympics in figure skating and she's been cancer-free for eight years.

9.title: The Kardashians Love Them: Are Waist Trainers Good for Your Health?
9.plot: Waist trainers are all of the rage among Hollywood celebrities. From the Kardashians to Jessica Alba, stars are raving about this corset that makes your waist smaller. Are they good for your health?

10.title: NAACP Image Awards: What Advice Would You Give Your Younger Self?
10.plot: At the 2016 NAACP Image Awards, Lifescript asked the female celebrities on the red carpet what advice they would give to their younger selves. The answers we received were smart, sassy and surprising.

11.title: 6 Great Health Tips from Hollywood Celebrities
11.plot: At the 2016 NAACP Image Awards, Lifescript asked the female stars on the red carpet for their best health tip. The women gave us some great advice for staying healthy.

12.title: Did You Know These Famous Stars Had Diabetes?
12.plot: A diabetes diagnosis can be difficult to any patient, but there are ways to control the disease. Find out how these Hollywood celebrities handled their diabetes diagnosis.

13.title: Celebs Tell Us: Who Is Your Female Mentor?
13.plot: At the 2016 NAACP Image Awards, celebrities like Kimberly Elise and Malika Haqq shared who their female mentors are and how they helped shape their lives. Who is your female mentor in your life?

14.title: Kimberly Williams-Paisley Gets Candid About Her Mother's Dementia
14.plot: Kimberly Williams-Paisley talked with Lifescript about her mother's rare form of dementia. The family hid her illness because there was so much shame surrounding the disease. Find out why she's sharing her family's story.

15.title: What Leeza Gibbons Learned During Her Mother's Alzheimer's Battle
15.plot: Caregiving is one of the hardest things to do when a loved one is suffering from Alzheimer's disease. Longtime advocate and talk show host, Leeza Gibbons, revealed the biggest lesson she learned from her mother's battle with the disease.

16.title: Keith Carradine Explains How He Handled His Father-in-Law's Alzheimer's Diagnosis
16.plot: Keith Carradine and his wife, Hayley DuMond, decided that taking care of her father in the home was the best way to handle his Alzheimer's diagnosis. Find out how it has benefited the family and his father-in-law.

17.title: Adrianne Haslet Runs Toward New Goals
17.plot: Adrianne Haslet-Davis survived the unimaginable at the 2013 Boston Marathon. The bombing might have changed the course of her life, but she's inspiring other amputees with her story and her athleticism.

18.title: Adrianne Haslet-Davis Is Not Only Surviving; She's Thriving
18.plot: Adrianne Haslet-Davis survived the unimaginable at the 2013 Boston Marathon. The bombing might have changed the course of her life, but she's inspiring other amputees with her story and her athleticism.

19.title: How IndyCar Driver Charlie Kimball Keeps His Type 1 Diabetes in Check
19.plot: IndyCar driver Charlie Kimball discovered he had Type 1 diabetes during a routine doctor's visit. He took a season off to get his health back on track and returned to the IndyCar racing circuit to great success in 2008.

20.title: Try These 5 Easy Sleep Tips from Arianna Huffington
20.plot: Arianna Huffington thinks the United States is in a sleep crisis. In this exclusive Lifescript interview, the Huffington Post founder gives five easy tips to get a better night's sleep. Learn more about "The Sleep Revolution."

21.title: The Surprising Way James Earl Jones Found Out He Had Type 2 Diabetes
21.plot: James Earl Jones is known for his roles in movies like 'Field of Dreams' and 'Star Wars.' The actor has also been living with type 2 diabetes for over two decades. Learn more about his journey with the disease.

22.title: Arianna Huffington Warns About the Sleep Crisis in America
22.plot: Huffington Post founder Arianna Huffington is warning people about the sleep crisis happening in the United States. From technology to a lack of time, many people are not making sleep a priority, which is vital to our health.

23.title: Why DWTS' Witney Carson Kept Her Melanoma Diagnosis Quiet
23.plot: Dancing With the Stars' Witney Carson battled melanoma just months before starting her first season as a pro on the dance competition show. She reveals why she waited so long to reveal her diagnosis and smart tips for avoiding skin cancer.

24.title: What Is Our Gut Trying to Tell Us About Our Health?
24.plot: Registered dietician and "Today Show" contributor Joy Bauer gives Lifescript the inside scoop on what our gut is trying to tell us about our health when it comes to gastrointestinal conditions like EPI- exocrine pancreatic insufficiency.

25.title: Why Joe Montana Is Taking His Heart Health Seriously
25.plot: NFL Hall of Fame quarterback Joe Montana and his wife are tackling heart health awareness. The duo have a family history of heart disease and Joe received a serious diagnosis after retirement that made him rethink his health regimen.

26.title: Opioid Addiction in Hollywood
26.plot: The death of Prince in April 2016 shined a spotlight on opioid addiction in Hollywood. It's an addiction that can affect anyone - from celebrities to suburbia.

27.title: How an Oscars Gifting Suite Saved Eric Roberts' Life
27.plot: Actor Eric Roberts felt like he was in great health until he took a blood test at an Oscars gifting suite. Find out about how one test saved his life and changed his perspective on heart health.

28.title: How Take Care of Yourself When a Loved One Has Alzheimer's Disease
28.plot: Taking care of a loved one who has Alzheimer's disease is tough. It's important to take care of your family member, but it's just as important to take care of yourself.

29.title: Michael J. Fox Tackles Parkinson's Disease with a Positive Mindset
29.plot: According to the Parkinson's Disease Foundation, nearly one million people in the US are living with Parkinson's disease. Find out how Michael J. Fox handles the challenges on a day-to-day basis.

30.title: What Women Really Need to Know About Heart Disease
30.plot: Dr. Kathy Magliato is one of the few female cardiothoracic surgeons in the world. She wants women to make heart health a priority with these simple recommendations.

31.title: Olympian Shannon Miller Wants Women to Learn the Signs of Ovarian Cancer
31.plot: 1996 U.S. Olympic gymnastics gold medalist Shannon Miller battled ovarian cancer in 2010. The athlete didn't realize the symptoms of a pelvic mass, so she's now sharing her knowledge with other women.

32.title: Joe Buck Knows Why Skin Cancer Is Serious Business
32.plot: Sportscaster Joe Buck knows that skin cancer is serious business after a family member was diagnosed with melanoma. He has some great tips for men - and women - on the importance of skin cancer prevention and detection.

33.title: How Brandi Chastain Manages Her Son's Crohn's Disease
33.plot: Brandi Chastain is a three-time Olympian who is used to dealing with challenges out on the soccer field. When her son was diagnosed with Crohn's disease in 2015, her family had to adapt to a new way of life.

34.title: Hollywood Health Report: Serene Branson Talks About Her On-Air Migraine Meltdown
34.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

35.title: Disney Star Brenda Song Stands Up to Cancer
35.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

36.title: Katie Couric Stands Up 2 Cancer
36.plot:
Know what this is about?

1.title: Hollywood Health Report: Eve Ensler, 'Vagina Monologues' Author, Speaks Out for Women
1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

2.title: Hollywood Health Report: How Clay Walker and Wife Manage Multiple Sclerosis
2.plot: When country singer Clay Walker was diagnosed with multiple sclerosis, his doctor said he wouldn't survive. 17 years later, he's managing his MS symptoms with treatment, lifestyle choices and caring support from his wife, Jessica.

3.title: Hollywood Health Report: Melissa Manchester at the California Women's Conference
3.plot: Lifescript health writer Diane Wedner catches up with Melissa Manchester, the Grammy award-winning singer and songwriter, discusses what she's doing to stay healthy, and how she's come to terms with her own body image.

4.title: Hollywood Health Report: Young Entrepreneur Patrick Schwarzenegger
4.plot: An interview with Patrick Schwarzenegger, the young son of actor-politician Arnold Schwarzenegger and journalist Maria Shriver. He's an "entrepreneur in progress" whose Project 360 business sells apparel to raise money for charity.

5.title: Hollywood Health Report: Jane Fonda Updates Her Exercise Videos for a New Generation of Women
5.plot: It's been 30 years since Jane Fonda started touting the benefits of cardiovascular workouts. The star is updating her signature exercise videos. and they aren't just for baby boomers, but for a whole new generation of women.

6.title: Hollywood Health Report - Venus Williams
6.plot: Tennis star Venus Williams about her plans for the future, how she recovers from injuries and how she is dealing with her diagnosis of Sjogren's Syndrome, a rare autoimmune disorder.

7.title: Hollywood Health Report - Paris Jackson Possible Suicide Attempt - Could It Be Prevented?
7.plot: After a lifetime in the public spotlight, late pop star Michael Jackson's 15-year-old daughter Paris was recently treated for a possible suicide attempt. Find out what led to her emotional crisis.

8.title: Hollywood Health Report: 'Cat Daddy' -- Jackson Galaxy's Tips for Taming the Krazy Kat in Your Home
8.plot: Training cats may seem impossible, but it's really not, according to Jackson Galaxy, who is better known as the "Cat Daddy" and host of the TV show, "My Cat From Hell." All you have to do is understand feline behavior.

9.title: Hollywood Health Report: Andie MacDowell Reveals Beauty Secrets
9.plot: Hollywood star Andie MacDowell is in her 50s, but looks much younger. What's behind her youthful looks?

10.title: Hollywood Health Report: Bill Clinton on Parenting
10.plot: Former president Bill Clinton is clearly a proud dad of his daughter, Chelsea, and her accomplishments. Lifescript.com caught up with both Clintons where we asked him for smart parenting tips.

11.title: Hollywood Health Report: Dennis Kucinich
11.plot: Some top politicians are turning vegan, including former congressman Dennis Kucinich, (D-Ohio). Watch as he explains how being vegan helps his health.

12.title: Hollywood Health Report: Mary Hart on Breast Cancer Prevention
12.plot: Mary Hart lost her grandmother to breast cancer and her mother was treated for it as well. Now the popular TV personality, who hosted "Entertainment Tonight" for three decades, is educating women about breast cancer prevention.

13.title: Hollywood Health Report: Exclusive Interview with Lisa Oz
13.plot: In this exclusive interview, Mari Cartel sits down with Lisa Oz and talks about family, health, well being and her latest projects.

1.title: Hollywood Health Report: Exclusive Interview with Sarah Palin
1.plot: Hollywood Health Report has an exclusive interview with Sarah Palin.

2.title: Hollywood Health Report -- 86th Academy Award Nominations
2.plot: Hollywood Health Report takes a look at the 86th Annual Academy Award nominations.

3.title: Tennis Star Pam Shriver: How I Relieve Joint Pain
3.plot: Pam Shriver describes how yoga, Pilates and deep breathing have helped other tennis players stay healthy. Shriver also discusses the importance of medical screenings and the benefits and drawbacks of being an older mom.

4.title: Amy Alcott's Secrets to Success
4.plot: In this exclusive interview with Ron Caporale at the Toshiba Classic, Amy Alcott discusses what it was like being a young woman golfer, the elements that went into becoming a champion player, and what female golfers should know today.

5.title: How "Beauty and the Beast" Star Austin Basis Deals with Type 1 Diabetes
5.plot: In this exclusive interview, Austin Basis details the differences between type 1 and type 2 diabetes, explains how he monitors his blood sugar and uses an insulin pump.

6.title: Kristin Chenoweth Knows Her Asthma Count, Do You?
6.plot: Who could imagine that Kristin Chenoweth has asthma. In this exclusive video, Lifescript sat down with the actress to talk about her asthma diagnosis and to find out how she manages her chronic condition.

7.title: Champion Swimmer Dara Torres on Fit Living and Safe Swimming
7.plot: At age 47, Olympic Gold Medalist Dara Torres is still super-fit. The athlete is enjoying her life as a role model both for little girls and for women who wonder if they're "too old" to accomplish something.

8.title: Swimmer Dara Torres: Has Your Child Been Vaccinated Against Meningococcal Meningitis?
8.plot: Meningococcal meningitis is a serious, sometimes fatal infection that can strike in the high school or college years. Two out of three moms don't know there's a vaccination for the bacterial disease, says Olympic Gold Medalist Dara Torres.

9.title: Arianna Huffington on Learning to "Thrive"
9.plot: Are you heading for burnout? Just a few years ago, Huffington Post founder Arianna Huffington was, the media mogul tells Lifescript's Mari Cartel in this exclusive interview.

10.title: Hollywood Health Report: Kevin Sorbo
10.plot: In this exclusive interview, Kevin Sorbo, best known for playing Hercules, talks about the strokes he suffered in 1997 and how he recovered.

11.title: Alana Stewart Shares Memories of Farrah Fawcett at Stand Up 2 Cancer-2014
11.plot: Alana Stewart shares Christmas memories about her dear friend, Farrah Fawcett, and how important it is to keep her legacy alive through the Farrah Fawcett Foundation.

12.title: The Daniel Twins Talk About Fighting Cancer at Stand Up 2 Cancer--2014
12.plot: Brittany Daniel and her twin sister, Cynthia Daniel, are known for Sweet Valley High (1994), but Brittany is proud of winning her cancer battle. In 2014, the actress announced she was healthy after being diagnosed in 2011 with stage IV non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.

13.title: Jon Hamm of 'Mad Men' Talks Colonoscopies at Stand Up to Cancer-2014
13.plot: Jon Hamm talked to Lifescript reporter Kristyn Burtt about his own personal experiences with cancer at Stand Up To Cancer in Hollywood.

14.title: Leukemia Survivor Kareem Abdul-Jabbar Reveals How He Was Diagnosed--2014 Stand Up 2 Cancer
14.plot: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar talked to Lifescript TV's Kristyn Burtt about his fight against leukemia and how he was diagnosed.

15.title: Tanya Young Williams on Surviving Domestic Abuse
15.plot: One in every four women will be a victim of domestic violence in her lifetime. In this exclusive article and video, domestic violence coach Tanya Young Williams explains how to spot the warning signs.

16.title: Celebs Turn Out to Support Courtney Galiano's 2014 the Beat MS Dance Walk
16.plot: Celebrities like Ricki Lake, Hunter Parrish and Corbin Bleu turn out to support "So You Think You Can Dance" star Courtney Galiano's charity to beat multiple sclerosis.

17.title: SYTYCD's Courtney Galiano Inspires Other Young Adults with Multiple Sclerosis
17.plot: Courtney Galiano from "So You Think You Can Dance" and "Hit the Floor" talks to Lifescript Entertainment Editor Kristyn Burtt about her multiple sclerosis diagnosis and how dance is helping her through her battle.

18.title: Former Ballerina Zippora Karz Offers Healthy Tips for Holiday Eating
18.plot: Former New York City Ballet soloist Zippora Karz shares some healthy holiday eating tips with Lifescript's Entertainment Editor Kristyn Burtt. The tips are perfect for someone with or without diabetes.

1.title: Diet and Fitness Tips from Bob Harper
1.plot: After more than a decade helping people lose weight on "The Biggest Loser, Bob Harper knows a thing or two about diet and exercise. In this exclusive interview the celebrity trainer shares his secrets for getting in shape.

2.title: Diet and Fitness Tips from Jennifer Widerstrom
2.plot: After helping people lose weight on "The Biggest Loser, Jennifer Widerstrom knows a thing or two about diet and exercise. In this exclusive interview the celebrity trainer shares her secrets for getting in shape.

3.title: Hollywood Health Report: Maria Shriver Fights Alzheimer's Disease
3.plot: Maria Shriver is fighting to wipe out Alzheimer's disease with a new program called, "Wipe Out Alzheimer's Challenge." Shriver and Maria C. Carrillo, Ph.D talk about the new initiative and the progress being made with research.

4.title: Celebrity Chef Gabe Kennedy Takes a Holistic Approach to Cooking
4.plot: Celebrity Chef Gabe Kennedy, winner of Season 3 of "The Taste" talked to Lifescript's Entertainment Editor Kristyn Burtt at the Natural Products Expo. He offered tips to get people back in their kitchen cooking healthy foods.

5.title: Jordan Geller: Sofia Vergara's Endocrinologist Speaks Up About Hypothyroidism
5.plot: Sofia Vergara's Endocrinologist, Dr. Jordan Geller, talks about the basics of hypothyroidism and what everyone needs to know about thyroid health.

6.title: Design Icon Iris Apfel's Strong Opinions on Fashion and a Female President
6.plot: Fashion icon Iris Apfel has gone Hollywood. She talked to Lifescript Correspondent Shanee Edwards about fashion tips for women and why a female president isn't necessarily the best thing for our country.

7.title: Alzheimer's Disease & Hollywood: A Celebrity Reveals His Diagnosis
7.plot: Hollywood is shedding light on Alzheimer's disease which has no cure, but is the sixth-leading cause of death. Find out the celebrity who recently revealed his Alzheimer's disease diagnosis and how he is doing now.

8.title: Mia Togo Proves That Yoga Is For Everybody At Dodgers Stadium
8.plot: Yogaworks teacher Mia Togo led a yoga class to over 1,000 participants at Dodgers Stadium. She talked to Lifescript about why yoga is about inclusion - it's for everybody.

9.title: Caitlyn Jenner Elevates the Transgender Profile in Hollywood
9.plot: Caitlyn Jenner has become an internet sensation. Her transition is resonating throughout the entertainment industry. From Netflix to ABC Family, more transgender stories are coming your way.

10.title: Lucy Hale Lends Her Voice to Meningitis Campaign
10.plot: 'Pretty Little Liars' star Lucy Hale teamed up with Voices of Meningitis campaign to help improve teen booster vaccination rates. Find out how she used her singing talents to get the message across.

11.title: Hugh Jackman Warns of Skin Cancer Dangers
11.plot: Hugh Jackman might be Hollywood royalty, but that doesn't exclude him from getting skin cancer. After 19 months of battling basal cell carcinoma, he's finally cancer-free. Find out what he wants you to do this summer.

12.title: Kristen Stewart Raises the Hollywood LGBT Profile
12.plot: While Kristen Stewart hasn't talked publicly about her dating life, her mother is revealing that love has no bounds. Jules Stewart shared that her daughter "loves women and men" in a recent interview.

13.title: Shatterproof Challenge Sends Participants Soaring 24 Stories Above LA
13.plot: The Shatterproof Challenge in downtown Los Angeles was designed to raise funds for addiction research and take away the stigma associated with the disease. Participants rappelled 24 stories down a building to help create awareness.

14.title: Tommy Chong Battles Rectal Cancer Pain with This Controversial Remedy
14.plot: Comedian Tommy Chong is finding himself staring at another cancer battle. He was recently diagnosed with rectal cancer and is using medical marijuana to deal with the related pain. Find out who else uses cannabis for pain management.

15.title: Celebrities Who Ate Their Placenta After Childbirth
15.plot: The trend in Hollywood for new moms is to eat their child's placenta after giving birth. Celebrities tout the benefits from increased energy levels to warding off postpartum depression, yet new study debunks these theories.

16.title: Hollywood's Latest Health Craze: Cryotherapy
16.plot: Would you jump into a chamber of liquid nitrogen gas at temperatures below 220 degrees? Celebrities and athletes are using the treatment for quick muscle recovery and other ailments.

17.title: Clay Walker Isn't Slowed Down by Multiple Sclerosis
17.plot: Country Singer Clay Walker has been battling Multiple Sclerosis for almost two decades. He attributes his continuing good health to his proactive doctors, nutrition and the love of his family.

18.title: Jackie Joyner-Kersee: Managing Pain After the Olympics
18.plot: Jackie Joyner-Kersee is a three-time Olympic gold-medal winner, but she's human just like us. She explains to Entertainment Editor Kristyn Burtt how she's managed her injuries and side effects after retiring from athletic competition.

19.title: Jeannie Mai's Fashion Tips for Patients with MS
19.plot: Fashion expert Jeannie Mai wants patients with Relapsing Multiple Sclerosis to know that fashion doesn't have to fall by the wayside because of their illness. She offers some great style-swap tips with a new program called Reimagine Myself.

20.title: Trainer Shapes Rebecca Ferguson Into 'Mission: Impossible' Action Star
20.plot: Trainer Sam Eastwood is known for shaping some of Hollywood's most famous bodies. She gave Lifescript the inside scoop on how she transformed 'Mission Impossible: Rogue Nation' actress Rebecca Ferguson into a strong, feminine action star.

21.title: Stars Reveal Why They Love Dance at 2015 Dizzy Feet Gala
21.plot: Dance is on the rise with shows like 'So You Think You Can Dance' and 'Dancing With the Stars' on network TV. At the 2015 Dizzy Feet Gala, celebs like Jenna Dewan Tatum, Christina Applegate and Lance Bass tell us why they love to dance.

22.title: Patricia Clarkson & Ben Kingsley Take the Wheel in 'Learning to Drive'
22.plot: Sometimes having a breakdown in life makes way for a breakthrough with a little help from an unlikely friendship. That's the premise of the new independent film, "Learning To Drive," starring Patricia Clarkson and Sir Ben Kingsley.

23.title: The Flying Wallendas: Mother-Daughter Team Soar High Together
23.plot: Rietta Wallenda and Lyric Wallenda Arestov are not your typical mother-daughter duo. They soar at astronomical heights on a daily basis as members of The Flying Wallenda family.

24.title: 92-Year-Old Phyllis Sues: Yogi, Dancer & Inspirational Woman
24.plot: Phyllis Sues is 92 years old, but she's proving that age is just a number. Take a look at how she keeps her mind and body in shape on a daily basis. She's truly an inspiration to us all.

25.title: Shemar Moore Champions His Mom and a Cure for MS
25.plot: Shemar Moore became a major contributor to multiple sclerosis fundraising after his mom was diagnosed in 1999. Find out how the "Criminal Minds" star reacted as a caretaker and how his mom is dealing with the disease.

26.title: Travis Stork's Four Tips for Cold and Flu Season
26.plot: Dr. Travis Stork talked to Lifescript's Mari Cartel about avoiding the dreaded cold and flu season. His four helpful tips are great reminders on how to stay healthy this winter.

27.title: Jen Arnold Stresses the Importance of Vaccination Timelines
27.plot: Dr. Jen Arnold is known to TV viewers as one half of TLC's "The Little Couple." She's also a neonatologist and pediatrician who is stressing the importance of following a vaccination timeline for your kids.

28.title: Kristin Chenoweth Champions 3D Mammography Technology
28.plot: Tony and Emmy Award-winning actress Kristin Chenoweth wants women to be the best advocates for their health. In addition to being the daughter of a two-time breast cancer survivor, she's discussing the latest in breast cancer screenings.

29.title: Amy Robach's Public Battle Against Breast Cancer
29.plot: 'GMA' news anchor Amy Robach had a very public battle against breast cancer. From her first mammogram to her final chemotherapy session, she shared her journey with viewers. Learn more about her story in our interview with her.

30.title: Pneumonia: How Tim Daly Saved His Mother's Life
30.plot: Tim Daly is warning about the dangers of pneumococcal pneumonia in people over the age of 50. He tells Lifescript how his quick thinking saved his mother's life and how others can reduce their pneumonia risk.

31.title: Tim McGraw Challenges People with Type 2 Diabetes
31.plot: Tim McGraw has seen the effects of Type 2 diabetes with family and friends. He's challenging people who are affected by the disease to learn and maintain their A1C levels.

32.title: Tim McGraw Chats About Type 2 Diabetes, Fitness and Family
32.plot: Raw, unedited footage of country superstar Tim McGraw's interview with Lifescript's Entertainment Editor Kristyn Burtt. He talks about the importance of health, fitness and his favorite cheat food when he splurges on a meal.

33.title: Ann Romney and Maria Shriver: "On Fire" About Neurologic Diseases
33.plot: Ann Romney is teaming up with Maria Shriver to raise funds for research for neurologic diseases. They hope to have women finance the research to find answers about diseases like multiple sclerosis and Alzheimer's disease.

34.title: Ann Romney's Multiple Sclerosis Mission
34.plot: In this exclusive Lifescript interview, Ann Romney talks about her new book, "In This Together," which chronicles her journey with multiple sclerosis. She's also actively involved in finding a cure with her research center.

35.title: SAG Awards: How Does Health Play a Role with this Year's Nominees?
35.plot: The 2015 Screen Actors Guild nominations are announced and Lifescript is taking a look at the health issues featured in this year's nominees. We also got some expert advice from actors JoBeth Williams and Jason George.

36.title: Why Fran Drescher Wants Women to Listen to Their Bodies
36.plot: Fran Drescher is a uterine cancer survivor and activist who wants women to pay attention to their health. Learn why she pushed her doctors for answers after several misdiagnoses when she wasn't feeling well.

37.title: Green Living: The World Is Finally Catching Up to Ed Begley, Jr.
37.plot: Ed Begley, Jr. and his wife, Rachelle Carson-Begley offer green-living tips for a home free from toxic elements. The actor has been ahead of the curve when it comes to sustainable practices, so he's considered an environmental expert.

38.title: Will Smith's 'Concussion' Shines Spotlight on NFL Safety
38.plot: The NFL has been answering questions about the safety of its players. Will Smith's movie, "Concussion," shines an even brighter spotlight on chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE) and how the league is handling the issue.

39.title: 'The Biggest Loser': Bob Harper's Tips for Keeping Weight Off
39.plot: For Season 17 of "The Biggest Loser," Lifescript's John Sylvain went behind the scenes to learn tips from host Bob Harper on how to keep weight off. John lost over 120 pounds and has maintained his weight for two years.

40.title: Why Elisabeth Röhm Wants You to Learn Hands-Only CPR
40.plot: Elisabeth Röhm is on a mission with the American Heart Association to get Hands-Only CPR added to every school curriculum. She shares why it's important to train students and the one popular song we all need to know to administer CPR.

41.title: Why Bob Harper Wants to Get Into Minds of 'The Biggest Loser' Contestants
41.plot: Season 17 host of "The Biggest Loser," Bob Harper, is ready to dive deep with the contestants to find out why they are overweight. In this exclusive Lifescript interview, Bob tells us how he's going to help their mental health.

-1.title: Maria Shriver Fights Alzheimer's Disease
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.
